page.title: 08HAND MADE INSTRUMENTS
page.content: Brian Carlick makes musical instuments by hand.He lives in Charlton-on-Otmoor. The thing he makes most of is the three holed pipe it is made out of wood and there are lots of different sizes. The three holed pipe is also his favourite thing to make. The bone recorder is the smallest thing he makes. He carves 17th century flutes from wood.The big flutes make a deep sound but the smaller flutes are higher.He gets his wood from one of the biggest wood merchants in Britain.The wood he uses is Cherry, Boxwood & Sycamore.The thing that takes longest to make is the gemshorn.No two gemshorns are exactly the same. Some are long and curved,some are short and straight,on some the outside is rough and blistery and he has to smooth it off.Normally the instruments take between six months and a year to make. He is making an organ for the Church.
